Sequence Information.Peptide Name: WAM2 (wallaby antimicrobial 2, MaeuCath5; natural AMPs; cathelicidins; Tammar, mammals, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: The sequences were originally reported by Dally KA et al 2008 Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol.  Mar;149(3):524-33).Activity: active against Gram- E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 1.46 uM), Sal. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 1.58 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 1.29 uM), Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 2.14 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 1.39 uM), Strep. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC 0.39 uM), Strep. uberis (MIC 0.63 uM), and fungi C. albicans ATCC 753 (MIC 1.47 uM).Updated 6/2024
Literature Information.Author: Wang J, Wong ES, Whitley JC, Li J, Stringer JM, Short KR, Renfree MB, Belov K, Cocks BG.2011
Literature Information.Title: Ancient antimicrobial peptides kill antibiotic-resistant pathogens: Australian mammals provide new options
